fields.description:
We use different custom field values to control some automations. Therefore it is necessary, that those fields show up on the create screen so the users may control the behaviour.

In our current setup we have a radio button with two options. We configured the field mandatory to hide the "none" option and we configured one option to be the default (pre-selected). Currently it is not possible to select the different option in the Outlook add-in since the field is not shown on the create screen.

In general it would really be helpful having more control about what fields are available on issue creation. It would be great if users could have a button "Configure Fields" (just like on Jira's create issue dialog), that enables them to select other fields configured on the issue's create screen in Jira. At least for those field types that are shipped with Jira by default.
fields.summary: Custom Fields for Issue Creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We can't have the same columns definition from Jira filters inside a tab in MS Teams.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use some specific columns on a Jira filter
# Use that filter inside a tab of MS Teams
# You can't configure the MS Teams' filters tabs.

h3. Expected Results

Have the same columns on both visualizations or have the option to change the MS Teams' view to match Jira.

h3. Actual Results

*Jira View:*
 !image-2021-01-18-11-09-33-716.png|thumbnail! 

*MS Teams View:*
 !image-2021-01-18-11-10-48-041.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: MS Teams doesn't match the Jira columns for filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting issues to excel from desktop downloads a zip file in firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In firefox, do a search on the advanced search page
 # Click on the "Open in Microsoft Excel" icon
 # Select Excel for desktop

h3. Expected Results
A file recognized by Excel should be downloaded

h3. Actual Results
A zip file is downloaded

h3. Workaround
The file can still be opened by Excel but the software does not recognize the format as an Excel file
Chrome is working properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Today with `/jira create` you cannot add attachments to an issue you are making from Slack. It would be helpful to add attachments from Slack.
fields.summary: Allow attachments to be added when creating an issue from Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Sheets integration uses Jira Cloud's API endpoints to retrieve data. 

When retrieving values from text fields, a string will be retrieved since that's the format returned by Jira's API endpoint.

That's true even if the text field contains only number characters.

As consequence, Sheets format the values as text on their side, and you won't be able to execute math functions towards those values, such as SUM.

h3. Suggestion

Provide an option to import values from text fields as number in case they contain number only characters.
fields.summary: Ability to configure value format of values imported from text fields in Sheets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some add-ons (Slack notifications, for example) add a user to the Space permissions, to be granted with permissions required to function properly. Although this is expected, the user name can be confusing and misleading, which could cause an admin to revoke necessary permissions. To add more context, Chat notifications is the user used by the Slack integration, however, that's not easily identified by the user name.
h3. Proposed Solution
 * Provide users the ability to re-name users created by integrations, such as Chat Notifications; or
 * Change the user created by the add-on to something more similar such as "Slack app", "Slack integration", "Slack notifications", etc.
fields.summary: Ability to re-name users created by integration apps

fields.description:
Currently we have to run {{bitbucket /connect <bitbucket-url>}} for each our repositories on the private Slack channel. But is it possible to create notifications for the entire team's repositories? I recall this was possible for GitHub Enterprise. Not sure if this is possible for Bitbucket Cloud.

Copy of [the question raised up here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Set-up-Bitbucket-bot-for-team-s-repositories/qaq-p/828169#M29023].
fields.summary: Set up Bitbucket bot for team's repositories

fields.description:
Currently, using [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] we can add notifications based on individual Jira Projects and filter down from there. However, we need to be able to create a notification based on a generic JQL query. 

For example, I have a current use case where I can send webhooks based on any JQL to the Legacy Slack integration. The JQL is based on specific labels that can span Jira Projects.

I also have another use case where all new Jira tickets that are created are sent to a single slack channel via the legacy integration.

We need to be able to emulate the same functionality using the [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Be able to send notifications based on generic JQL without having any project selected

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the "Notify Watchers" checkbox has to be checked in order for page update notifications to be sent to Slack. If the checkbox isn't checked, then no page update notifications will be sent to users in Slack.

h3. Proposed
Allow the notifications to be sent based on the Slack configuration in the space/site-level regardless of whether the "Notify Watchers" flag is enabled or not.

This can also be a feature that can be toggled in the UI globally or per space.
fields.summary: Allow Slack notifications for page updates to be sent regardless of whether "Notify Watchers" is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some of the icons for the Atlassian Cloud for Gmail add-on for Gmail simply do not load.
The Icon for the app itself is even missing causing it to be invisible, and some other Icons show as a default media thumbnail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # install Atlassian Cloud for Gmail if it is not already installed for you
 # use the add-on

h3. Expected Results

All images load and the app appears as expected.

h3. Actual Results

Icons do not load.

h3. Workaround

You can continue to use the app normally, however the app icon in the sidebar will be an empty space.
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud for Gmail Icons not loading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While customer try to open the issues via "Open in google sheets" and "Open in Microsoft Excel", some of the custom field values are missing even though they are visible in the UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the filter which has the required issues you would like to see.
 # Click on "Open in Google sheets" or "Open in Microsoft Excel".
 # Now compare the fields in the UI with the sheets/excel and you can find that some of the field values are missing.

h3. Expected Results
- We must see all the custom field values in the "Open in Google sheets" or "Open in Microsoft Excel" as we are seeing in the advanced issue search UI.

h3. Actual Results
- We do not see some of the custom field values inside these Google sheets/MS Excel.

h3. Workaround
- You can use "export excel CSV(all fields)" to see all these fields however, you might see multiple columns with the same custom field. However, we do have a request to remove these  duplicate columns in the export here - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ADOC-27732

fields.description: It appears I can’t create new labels from this plugin. When I enter a string that doesn’t exist, it accepts it but does not create the label in Jira. Ideally, new labels would be created, or they wouldn’t accept strings that are not found.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In order to connect a Slack channel to a Jira project, you need to use the command */jira connect*, which will prompt you to select the project and the channel you want to connect that project to.

But, currently, if the project's name has about 70 characters, the integration will not present you the connect button:
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-03 at 09.16.43.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a project with over about 70 characters on its name (space counts);
* Try connecting with that project trough Slack by using */jira connect*.

h3. Expected Results

The integration will present you the connect button to conclude the connection.

h3. Actual Results

The integration will not present you the connect button.

h3. Workaround

Shorten the project's name, or try connecting trough the project settings at:
* Project settings -> *Slack integration*.
fields.summary: When project name has about 70 characters, user is unable to connect trough Slack

fields.description:
Currently, the app only allows data refresh manually, hourly, daily, weekly or at the last friday of the month.

It'd be useful to have custom schedules or more options, such as "at the end of the month" for monthly reports.
fields.summary: Add the ability to set a custom schedule to get issues on Jira Cloud for Sheets

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like to customize the add-on to let me select a value on a Custom field of type *Project Picker* when creating Jira issues through "Jira Cloud for Outlook".

Currently, we see a message: 
{quote}_"None of the issue types in this project are supported. Please select another project to create new issues."_{quote}
When trying to create an issue in a project that has a custom field of type *Project Picker* as a required field.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Outlook - Allow adding the Project Picker Custom field when creating Jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When drafting a comment in an Adaptive Card, after the user presses “Save”, the Save button is still enabled. The comment gets saved to the backend and is shown when you view the issue in the browser, but some user feedback that the comment is saved would be good.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Draft a new comment in an Adaptive Card
 # Press the Save Button

h3. Expected Results

The comment is saved and confirmation is sent to the user.
h3. Actual Results

The comment is saved but there is no confirmation sent to the user.
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: Feedback when Saving on a Adaptive Card

fields.description: Currently, Jira Cloud for Outlook doesn't support single or multiple group picker custom field. This is a blocker for some teams as they might have this field as required.
fields.summary: Add support for single/multiple group picker custom field

fields.description:
I would like to restrict comments to a certain project role or group as I can do in Jira
 !image-2020-11-25-18-43-45-152.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Restrict comments to certain group or project role

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Cloud for Sheets is exporting issues with -1 hour when using daylight savings time zones.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open the google sheets.
 # go to "File" >> "Spreadsheet settings".
# change to a time zone with daylight savings, for example (GMT-5 or GMT+1).

h3. Expected Results
It should export the issue at the same time without this conversion to minus 1 hour.

h3. Actual Results
It seems that the REST API is sending the field with 00:00:00Z (UTC) value and then the Google Sheets seems to be converting it to -1 hour, which causes the field to be filled with the previous day.

h3. Workaround
Our suggestion is to try to create a workaround in Sheets to round the date value up which adds the proper/expected date.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Sheets is exporting issue with -1 hour when using daylight savings time zones

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud displays the avatar for users that have either created or edited the page right under its title. In case the page was created and edited by the same user, *only one avatar will be displayed* (the user avatar won't be duplicated). However, if you access this same page on Microsoft Teams, two avatars will be displayed for the same user.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and publish a page on Confluence Cloud.
 # Edit this page.
 # Note that the page only displays one avatar.
 # Access this page on Microsoft Teams.

h3. Expected Results

The page should display only one avatar, as it happens on Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

The page displays the avatar of the user twice.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages on Microsoft teams display duplicated avatars (even if the page was created and modified by the same user)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Google Sheets integration, there are some fields that contain "sub-rows" to be selected.
For example, Sprint, Linked issues:
*  !Screen Shot 2020-11-23 at 10.30.18.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-11-23 at 10.30.09.png|thumbnail! 

The values in the main field are static, meaning that they don't change based on the selections. The result might be misleading for users since there will be duplicate rows. 

For example, when it comes to linked issues, if you select *Linked Issues.linkType* along with the main field *Linked Issues*, you will see multiple rows of the same issue because the integration needs to show a row for each link type corresponding to each linked issue. But since the *Linked Issues* value is static, it will show all linked issues in the same cell in all rows, despite those being associated with the link type displayed in the row or not:
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-13 at 13.43.42.png|thumbnail! 

PS. In the case above, you should go for *Linked Issues.id* instead of the main *Linked Issues* field to have a more accurate result.

h3. Suggestion

Make the main fields' column results adapt to the sub-rows selected. Or, give more configuration options to users so they can choose the behaviour.
fields.summary: Better display when selecting "sub-rows" in Google Sheets

fields.description:
h3. What? 

When "New Outlook" is enabled on Outlook for Mac, email attachments are not attached to the issue when using "Include email" and/or "Include attachments" on "Create issue" or "Send to issue" screens.

h3. Why?
This is due to a bug in Outlook functionality which Jira Cloud for Outlook add-in depends on.

h3. Workaround
Turn off "New Outlook" until the bug is fixed on the Outlook side.

*UPDATE:* The Outlook team has fixed all bugs related to attachments. Please update Outlook for Mac to version 16.45 (20122006) or higher (depending on the channel it might take up to a month to get this update, it's available now through the beta channel).

----

We will update this ticket once the issue is fixed on the Outlook side.

For technical details, [follow this Github issue|https://github.com/OfficeDev/office-js/issues/1400].
fields.summary: Email attachments are not attached to issue in "New Outlook" for Mac

 !image-2020-11-18-18-22-17-775.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability of when the issue is commented in JIRA, the comment is added to the thread that was created with the issue (or in a single thread per issue), instead of being added as a new separated comment on Slack.

Or to have the link of the thread added as an internal comment (or in another way) inside the ticket that was created. With this customers can send the last comment via Automation.

This would be great for teams that work using Slack, as all issue data would be related to a single thread.

!8yng_KNXrarT2TTtDqkuzjxDfyhBzN8P1g.png|width=618,height=541!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users have the Jira Cloud Teams integration. They have noted that one of them has proper layout when creating issue from teams chat, while another user drops "project list" down and sees a lot of formatting issues such as text overlapping icons, text under other text, etc. They both use Mac Desktop clients for Teams.

Correct 

!Correct.png|width=558,height=545!

Incorrect

!Incorrect.png|width=503,height=491!

Other info from customer:
 * Our testing is limited to <5 users.
 * Only 1 user is experiencing this “overlap issue”
 * Me and 2 other users see things just fine
 * We had the affected user check Web version and it appears equally affected (not formatted correctly).
 * He logged off, rebooted client, and logged back to both Teams and Jira and still sees issue.
 * We toggled light/dark themes to see if that helped to no avail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Tabs 
 # Click "Create issue"
 # Click on a projects drop-down 

h3. Expected Results

Projects' icons are readable and not blurred
h3. Actual Results

Projects' icons are blurry; Getting 403 errors for a number of the “avatars” displayed for individual Projects.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: formatting issues in MS Teams for Jira Cloud

fields.description:

Authorization is successful 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
[c.m.teams.service.SignalRService] startConnectionIfDisconnected() error (java.lang.RuntimeException): java.io.IOException: Unexpected response code for CONNECT: 403
 Caesium-1-4 INFO ServiceRunner     [c.m.teams.service.SignalRService] SignalR connection is currently false
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We are Atlassian Gold Solution Partner's / Marketplace Vendors. We have a client who uses your Microsoft Teams for JIRA plugin and is merging 3 of their Jira Cloud instances together. The target instance is [https://intellihub.atlassian.net/] SEN-6199072 The two are instances being merged into the above are these. [https://metrix.atlassian.net/] [https://acumenmetering.atlassian.net/] The process will most likely involve export from all 3, merge on the temporary Jira Server and then re-import into Cloud. We will do a TEST migration into a new temporary Jira Cloud instance and then eventually a PROD one, effectively overwriting the target one with the merged data. Our questions to you are.. 1) What steps (if any) do we need to take to retain the functioning installation of Microsoft Teams for JIRA after the merge is finished on the PROD Cloud instance - keeping in mind we will likely be having to export/merge/re-import/overwrite? 2) Is there a way for us to get Microsoft Teams for JIRA working on the TEMP Cloud instance during the test migration? i.e. is it possible for you to duplicate your instance of the PROD Cloud data so we can properly run our TEST Cloud instance with data? We would ideally leave our actual PROD data untouched on your end 3) With regards to the first two questions, can you also please cover how we can re-authenticate our instances with your end if this is necessary? 4) Do you require any lead time before we start doing the migration? 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

None
h3. Expected Results

None
h3. Actual Results

None
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User is merging 3 of their Jira Cloud instances together and they have questions about this

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We use “Jira Server” app for MS Teams and Jira integration in our company. The details from our developer: All operations with the app stopped working. If the bot is told to "create", a window with an error "Unable to access the app. Try again." appears. When it worked, it looked like this: a) the response to the bot's commands is delayed for a period of up to several tens of seconds. b) on the "create" command, a window with the "create" button appears, after clicking on which a window for entering the signature should appear. The time before this window appeared was sometimes extended to several minutes. C) when using messaging extensions, the issues list might appear in a few tens of seconds. etc. Since we have a separate server allocated for testing (which is not loaded with anything else), and monitoring confirms that there is no load on this server, we assume that all delays occur on the application side. The details from our tester: I have tried to open chatbot tab assigned to me after the timeout for four-hour. The loading was really long (more than 30 seconds) and the errors appeared in the console while loading. Then the app stopped working with error. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue in Bot 
 # error "Unable to access the app. Try again." appears or the response to the bot's commands is delayed for a period of up to several tens of seconds

h3. Expected Results

Issues are created and loaded in 2-3 seconds
h3. Actual Results

Issues either are not created or it takes some time to load it.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slow performance while creating issues in Bot via MS Teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer is facing the following issue: _Failed to generate authorization link. Please contact your Jira Server administrator and confirm Application link for Microsoft Teams app has been properly configured_. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Copy Jira ID from the Configuration page of the add-on ( in Jira) 
 # Step 2: Add Jira Server to MS Teams 
 # type 'connect' to connect to your Jira.
 # Sign in
 # Authorize 
 # Enter Jira ID that you've copied and Click connect 

h3. Expected Results

it should authorize the user and connect to their Jira 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{code:java}
Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: unable to create new native thread java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread
{code}

Which indicates that the memory limit was reached. Tentatively some Jira app is creating threads and never ended them.
They got 2618 threads spawned by Jira. After a thread dump and upload to fastthread.io for analysis, immediately showed the warning:



!https://attachment.freshdesk.com/inline/attachment?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpZCI6MTYwNTYxNjY5NjYsImRvbWFpbiI6InNvZnRzZXJ2ZWluYy5mcmVzaGRlc2suY29tIiwiYWNjb3VudF9pZCI6Mzk0OTMzfQ.bqrUVFlWFwPM46GByvZy3b4u8W8N0J3TH-Uy48iZtrg|width=594,height=117!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User was getting "Failed to generate authorization link, please contact jira server admin" error message. This seems to have abruptly stop working last week and they have tried several things while troubleshooting. In the past they have ran into a similar issue where multiple instances were using the same server ID, which created a conflict and prevented authentication. This time around they removed the records in the db, which automatically recreated a new server ID, public key, and private key. Even using the newly created ID, they still ran into the same issue. Support team advised to  put all SSL certificates to the trusted root certificate of the JAVA - it helped but after that user faced an error related to the Oauth token.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 We noticed an issue with our Jira Service and the Microsoft Teams for Jira Server Plugin. Our Jira Server is constantly throwing following error string: ERROR ServiceRunner [c.microsoft.signalr.HubConnection] HubConnection disconnected with an error: Server timeout elapsed without receiving a message from the server The only solution for this is to disable the plugin and restart the Jira Service. We do this because our Jira Service is going down after some minutes due to thread overload. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

After connecting Jira to Microsoft Teams, the following symptoms may be displayed:
 * The app shows disconnected either immediately or a short time later.  The longest reported connection was less than 24 hours. 

 * You may see in incrementing number of open files for Jira.  

 * You may see an incrementing number of open threads in Jira.  

h3. Expected Results

No errors in logs
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file: [^atlassian-jira (1).log]
{noformat}
ERROR ServiceRunner [c.microsoft.signalr.HubConnection] HubConnection disconnected with an error: Server timeout elapsed without receiving a message from the server.. 
ERROR [c.microsoft.signalr.HubConnection] HubConnection disconnected with an error: Server timeout elapsed without receiving a message from the server..{noformat}
This may appear as thousands of threads in a thread dump or in the catalina.out log:
{code:java}
Ok Http WebSocket https://msteams-jira-server.service.signalr.net/... priority:5 - 
threadId:0x0000000000001784 - nativeId:0 - nativeId (decimal):0 - state:WAITING 
stackTrace: java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking) 
at java.base@11.0.6/jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method){code}
h3. Workaround

Completely uninstall the Teams app and Jira integration from both sides. Simply disabling the app has been shown to not stop threads from incrementing.
fields.summary: Getting error while trying to log in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Multiple users reported an issue where they receive 502 Bad Gateway nginx error from auth.atlassian.net after putting in the email to authenticate. The issue is reproducible for Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud users. For some users the issue does not exist if they are using MS Teams web version, however, for others the issue is reproducible on both desktop and web versions. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Jira Cloud Tab to Microsoft Teams (step 1 and step 2 screenshots)
 # Enter Jira Cloud URL and click Connect button (step 3 screenshot)
 # Click Authorize in Jira (step 4 screenshot) 
 # Log in to Jira, enter email address and click Continue (step 5 screenshot)
 # 502 Bad Gateway nginx error received (502 bad gateway screenshot)

h3. Expected Results

Users are successfully authenticate via both desktop and web versions of Microsoft Teams and can successfully use the integration.
h3. Actual Results

Users cannot authenticate and receive 502 Bad Gateway error message. 
h3. Workaround

Some users can successfully authenticate via MS Teams web version. 

If the issue exists in web version of the app too:
 # Ask the user to open an incognito mode browser tab and try the same steps as they would normally do.
 # In case the 502 error happens, ask the user to try to log in on their instance.
 ** They should be disconnected with the following icon being shown in the top right:
 ** [!_thumb_5272290.png|thumbnail!|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/5272290/5272290_screenshot-1.png]
 # Ask them to log in on their instance
 # If everything works correctly, ask them to repeat the integration process on MS Teams app

fields.description:
This request is to make MS TEAMS works exactly in the same way as JIRA UI. Because nowadays, if you click on CREATE missing some required fields, JIRA will display a message at the top showing you which fields need to be fulfilled.

If the JIRA instance has required custom fields that are not supported by MS TEAMS (example: Scripted fields by ScriptRunner), those fields will not be displayed on MS TEAMS.

Therefore, from the MS TEAMS user perspective, all the required fields are being fulfilled, however, that's not the truth, because the custom fields which were not rendered will prevent the CREATE Button to be clickable.

If we display the list of required fields anywhere (like near the Create button), we will show to the users which custom field is preventing them from creating the ticket.

fields.description:
We need to provide our customers with more information on the architecture details of how the Jira Server for Microsoft Teams plugin work.
 The document we currently have in the link: [https://www.msteams-atlassian.com/JiraServer/] is very abstract and doesn't give any insight on how the plugin works.

We need to have some architecture diagrams to show how the plugin connects to Microsoft teams and what are the services that work in between Jira and the Microsoft Teams.
 Having a clear block diagram would help very much in describing the architecture.
 We would need to identify all the Azure services that will directly interface with the plugin on the customer side, Identifying their IP address ranges and their function.

Also the document: [https://www.msteams-atlassian.com/JiraServer/] requests the customer to white list a large list of IPs, it doesn't tell why those needs to be white-listed and what are the hosts/services that correspond to those IPs which makes the job of justifying those white-lists difficult.

Moreover for customer using an *outbound proxy*, the documentation must be adjusted as well. The outbound proxy configuration must be adjusted to allow Jira to reach those IP through outbound proxy.

It is unclear also that it is a bidirectional integration between the Jira server itself and the Teams application. Jira needs to communicate to the following endpoints (plus a few additional others), _but_ these same endpoints/networks also need to communicate with Jira:
 * [https://jira-server.msteams-atlassian.com|https://jira-server.msteams-atlassian.com/]
 * [https://msteams-jira-server.service.signalr.net|https://msteams-jira-server.service.signalr.net/]
 * [https://connectors.msteams-atlassian.com|https://connectors.msteams-atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Need to have more documentation on architecture and operation detail of the  Jira Server for Microsoft Teams Plugin

fields.description:
When creating a Jira issue using the create screen presented by the integration on MS Teams' channel, if a user misses populating a value on a mandatory field, the error message is misleading :
*Error*
 *An unhandled error occurred. We are working on it.*

This error occurs when the field is not required on Jira but Scriptrunner has a condition that turns the field as mandatory depends on the value selected on another field.

The add-on script was not created to run on MS teams, so the condition is not executed. The issue fails to be created on Jira.

We would expect a clear message returned to MS Teams explaining why the error had occurred (Field xxx was not filled).

*Environment*
 Jira Server 8.5.4
 Microsoft Teams for Jira v.2020.5.1
Scriptrunner add-on
fields.summary: Unclear error message "An unhandled error occurred" when creating issue on MS teams and not filling a required field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
During the issue creation (on MS Teams app already integrated with JIRA using the MS Teams for JIRA Plugin) the Custom Fields of type "Single Choice" with disabled options displays all their options (including the disabled ones).

Jira version: 8.5.4
MS Teams for Jira plugin version: 2020.5.1
Microsoft Teams Version 1.3.00.18164


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure your JIRA and MS Teams to accept Issue creation through the MS Teams app.
 # On JIRA, create a new Custom Field with type: "Single Choice" (Administration > Issues > Custom Field > Add Custom Field > *Select List (Single Choice)*)
 # Configure this Custom Field to have some options
 # The next screen will ask you to associate field to some screens. Add it to the creation screens you will use for the test.
 # Disable 1 option from this Custom field (Admin > Issues > Custom Field > in the Custom Field's line you created > Click on the Cogwheel > Configure)
 # Click in Disable for 1 option;

If you try to create an issue directly in JIRA, you won't see the disabled option. However, it's available to be selected through the MS Teams, and worse, the issue can be created selecting this disabled option.

h3. Expected Results
MS Teams to do NOT display disabled options of Single Choice custom fields during the issue creation.
h3. Actual Results
MS Teams is displaying all the options of Single Choice custom fields during the issue creation. In addition, it's enabling us to create issues with this disabled option selected.

h3. Workaround
No workaround found.
fields.summary: During the issue creation (on MS Teams app already integrated with JIRA using the MS Teams for JIRA Plugin) the Custom Fields (type Single Choice) display disabled options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom Fields with same names in next-gen projects not populating data  when exporting when we use *open in Microsoft Excel* option

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Create custom fields with same name in multiple next-gen projects
 # Step 2: Populate the custom fields by creating tickets in next-gen projects
 # Step 3: Run an advanced issue search and the Custom Field in the column
 # Step 4: click on *open in Microsoft Excel* option


h3. Expected Results

The exported excel sheet should contain the data for the Custom Field

h3. Actual Results

Custom Field data in the exported excel sheet is empty.


h3. Workaround

Use the Export to CSV option or you could also consider renaming the custom field
fields.summary: Custom Fields with same names in next-gen projects not populating data  when exporting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an option to configure Slack personal notifications for users in Jira where they should receive slack notifications for updates on issues they are watching/assigned to.

We noticed that no matter how many people are added to the issue (assignee and watchers), only one receives the direct notifications in Slack. Here is an example:

Person A) Assignee
 Person B) Watcher
 Person C) Watcher
 Person D) Watcher
 Person E) Edit for example a field

--> Only person B) or C) gets in Slack a message that the issue field was updated.

--> If the watcher (who gets the notifications) leaves the watching mode --> only the assignee gets the notification.

--> Usually, I get only Slack direct notification if I am the only watcher.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Jira with Slack following this guide: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/slack/using-jira-applications-with-slack-966662163.html].
 # Create two or more users in Jira.
 # Connect their Slack accounts and set the Slack personal notifications in Jira under _Profile > Tools_ as follows:
 !SlackNotificationsUser1.png|width=249,height=118! 
 !SlackAccountUser1.png|width=250,height=135!
 # Create a new issue and add the users to receive notifications (Assignee and watchers).
 # Add an update to the issue and check if the users receive direct notifications on Slack.

h3. Expected Results

All the watchers and the assignee who had configured the direct notifications should receive the message in Slack.
h3. Actual Results

Only one watcher receives a direct notification.

*+Note:+*
 I have also noticed that some authorizations that Jira has in the Jira Server app in Slack were only granted by one user. For instance, although the settings are exactly the same for both users, I see that some authorizations like "Add the ability for people to direct message or mention @jira_server" and "View basic information about a user’s group direct messages" is always granted by one team member.
 !Jira_Authorization.png|width=232,height=121!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

+*Notes*+
{panel}
P.S: A bug in GitHub has been created for this issue: [https://github.com/atlassian-labs/atlassian-slack-integration-server/issues/48]
{panel}
This was tested with the [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official] plugin version 2.0.13
fields.summary: Jira to Slack direct notifications are not sent to all recipients

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to receive Slack Channel notifications to a shared channel (Slack Enterprise Grid Workspace)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect a Project with your Slack channel
 # Create an issue in your project

h3. Expected Results
Receive the Slack notification from the Jirabot
h3. Actual Results
No notifications get sent

Subscription to shared channel receives channel_not_found when posting notification

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to receive Slack Channel notifications to a shared channel (Slack Enterprise Grid Workspace)

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
 At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Teams bot cannot process the multibyte text longer than 2 characters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure an issue existing with JQL *_text ~ "サンプル"_* in Jira
 ** !Screen Shot 2020-09-30 at 17.20.37.png|thumbnail!
 # Try _*find サンプル*_ command on Teams
 ** !Screen Shot 2020-09-30 at 17.19.37.png|thumbnail!
 # See the bot responses saying "We didn't find any issues, try another keyword"

h3. Expected Results

Search works with non-ASCII text.
h3. Actual Results

The bot fails to handle multibyte text longer than 2 characters.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
 Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Teams bot only can handle the multibyte text with 2 characters or less

fields.description:
These days more and more users prefer interfaces with dark backgrounds or, simply put, "dark mode".

Users can set the dark mode of Outlook desktop clients as well as in web app.

The Jira Cloud for Outlook add-in though doesn't currently have an option of setting its theme to dark.

Here's a section of Outlook web app with dark mode and Jira app opened:

!Screenshot 2020-09-29 at 13.09.58.png!
fields.summary: Dark mode in Outlook add-in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epic Link Status always shows as To Do on Google Sheets.

If we change the Epic status to In Progress or Closed, even refreshing the issues, the Epic link status still shows as To Do.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Epic link to issues.
 # On Google Sheets, click on Add-ons > Jira Cloud for Sheets > Open > Get issues from Jira.
 # Filter by JQL and on fields select Epic Link and Epic Link.Status.
 # Click on Get Issues Now.

h3. Expected Results

It will show on Epic Link.Status the same status as we see in Jira.
h3. Actual Results

It shows the status To Do.

!Screen Shot 2020-09-25 at 14.24.48.png|width=260,height=141!

!Screen Shot 2020-09-25 at 14.28.30.png|width=766,height=242!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Epic Link Status always shows as To Do on Google Sheets

fields.description:
Most of Outlook clients support categories on emails. It would be great to add the "Jira" category to each email in these cases:
 * Email contains a reference to a Jira issue
 * Jira issue was created out of the email
 * Email was sent to an existing Jira issue

Adding a category to emails would help to organize the inbox find triaged emails quicker.
fields.summary: Add a category to emails with Jira "inside"
Somehow mark issues created from Jira Cloud for Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have an IP allowlisting policy enforced on your instance then Jira Cloud Sheets won't be able to connect or authenticate because the add-on is not automatically allowlisted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect to your Jira Cloud as described in [Use Jira Cloud for Sheets|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/use-jira-cloud-for-sheets/]

h3. Expected Results

Successfully connected and can start using JQL to pull issue data from Jira

h3. Actual Results

{code}
You have been deauthorized from Jira. Please connect to continue.
{code}
 !You_have_been_deauthorized.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Please contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] so we can apply a workaround to fix this.
fields.summary: Unable to connect to instance with an IP policy enforced

fields.description:
It's possible to edit a page on Confluence, and disable the notification for watchers about this change. This is very useful when the page is still under construction, to avoid spamming watchers with multiple notifications about frequent edits on the same page. However, disabling this flag doesn't affect the Slack notification subscription to the page or Space. That said, if the subscription is set to notify about page updates, this update will be notified on Slack. That said, Slack channels get spammed with notifications in this scenario.

h4. Proposed Solution

Extend the watcher disablement to the add-on integration, so when this flag is off, Slack notifications wouldn't send updates to the channels as well.
fields.summary: Disable Slack notification for updates on pages when the notify watchers flag is turned off

fields.description:
For some customers use cases, it would be nice to implement a way of changing how the issue key is unfurled and avoid some false positive, as the example below:

Slack message: https://fisheye.xxx.xxx.com/cru/C-ISS-458
If it exists a project on Jira cloud with key "ISS" and with issue num "458", the slack bot would be triggered.
fields.summary: Change regex for matching issue keys

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the old issue view experience in Jira, the Jira Cloud for Slack side panel renders with an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue that has mentions in Slack, in an instance with the app properly set up.
 # Switch to old issue view experience.

h3. Expected Results

Display issue mentions in Slack.
h3. Actual Results

The panel will display:
{noformat}
{"error":{"message":"Token not found","code":"AUTHENTICATION_FAILED"}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Switch to the new issue view experience.
fields.summary: Viewing old issue view causes Slack integration side panel to render an error

fields.description:
Currently, when using the Slack for JIRA integration, you can set when a notification should be sent to Slack.

 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 6.36.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

As a user, I would also like to customize which fields will be displayed on Slack notifications.
fields.summary: JIRA for Slack integration: Ability to customize which fields will be displayed on Slack notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

I am using the HTML text renderer (provided via the [JEditor app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210768/jeditor-rich-text-editor-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview]) to allow HTML comments in Jira. When those comments are sent to Slack via the official Slack Integration, the HTML formatting is preserved. This makes those messages difficult to read.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to convert HTML to Slack markup for comments containing HTML.

h3. Workaround 

Switching to the Wiki style renderer for issue summary, description, and comments resolves the issue and message formatting is preserved. This is not a good option for teams who wish to use the HTML renderer for any reason.
fields.summary: HTML tags appear in slack for messages sent via "Jira Server for Slack (Official)" app

fields.description:
"/jira create", mimics the ticket creation process, but not for the service desk portal ticket creation because it misses the Request Types on the Issue Type field. 

It would be of great value to have the portal request types displayed on the issue type box, so that our customers could stay in slack while creating support tickets.

 

!image-2020-08-21-12-18-19-136.png|width=495,height=391!
fields.summary: Present and accept Request Types on the Issue Type field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to use the add-in (Jira Cloud for Excel) from Microsoft Team, the add-in display an error. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Teams → Files → Open Excel File (Excel File is opened with Add-In on the right sidebar)
 # Add-In: Click on ‘Get Started’ button → click on ‘Allow’ button (Login Successful in default browser)
# Go back to Teams

h3. Expected Results
No warnings in Add-In, User is logged in to Add-In and is able to use it

 Excel File is opened and contains Jira data
h3. Actual Results
Warning appears in Add-In: “The security settings in your browser prevent us from creating a dialog box. Try a different browser, or configure your browser so that 'https://jira-spreadsheets.services.atlassian.com' and the domain shown in your address bar are in the same security zone.

h3. Workaround

Use Excel Online or access it from Window Environment.
fields.summary: Microsoft team add-ins error for Mac user.

fields.description:
It would be great to have the ability for JSD Portal-only customers to be able to raise request from Slack with Jira Service Desk Cloud for Slack (EAP).

At the moment, only JSD agents ( licensed users ) can raise requests using Jira Service Desk Cloud for Slack (EAP).
fields.summary: Allow Portal-only customer to raise request from Slack

fields.description:
As a Jira administrator, I would like to customize the add-on to let me enter a value for the Tempo field "Account" when creating Jira issues through "Jira Cloud for Outlook".

Use case: I have the Tempo field "Account" as required in Jira, and due to this, I'm unable to create new issues through the add-on since it is not possible to enter a value for the Tempo field "Account".
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Outlook - Allow adding the Tempo field "Account" when creating Jira issues

fields.description:
I have a spreadsheet with a list of issuekeys:

 

MYPROJECT-123

MYPROJECT-456

…

 

I'm trying to simply add a column giving the summary.  However, this doesn't work for a couple of reasons:
 * even with 'limit 1' two rows are pulled in. ,one for the header!  GIve me a way to omit the header row (maybe 'limit 0' or 'limit -1'?)
 * The header rows are localized to my Jira UI language (which is fine, but Summary is labelled Resumen - for programmatic import, it might be better to use non-localized headings or make it controllable)
fields.summary: Need way to omit header row

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user tries to order a custom field it comes back to the original place. This happens because in the field ordering setup there is a custom field that was deleted in Jira Cloud. Follow below a video showing the issue:
* https://share.getcloudapp.com/9Zuj5zgm

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Jira Cloud for Sheets;
# Setup the fields you want to appear in the search (set at least 2 custom field);
# Go to Jira and delete one of the custom fields set in the add-on;
# Refresh the Jira Cloud for Sheets and open again;
# Try to reorder the remaining custom field.

h3. Expected Results
The deleted custom fields should not be impacting on the other custom field when reordering. 

h3. Actual Results
It is not possible to reorder a custom field.

h3. Workaround

To fix it, you need to "Reset to Jira user defaults" and set all the fields again.
fields.summary: Issue when ordering custom fields on Jira Cloud for Sheets add-on

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When the customers are internal users and have access to Slack, they can receive notifications on Slack about their issues, but cannot use the link sent within the message as it has the internal link for the issues and not the portal one.

h3. Suggested resolution
Create the ability to choose what link to send, the portal issue link or the Jira's one.
fields.summary: Ability to change the issues URL for customers and internal users

fields.description: We do not always have a status change that we want to listen to but also events that are thrown in a transition. So that would be fantastic to be able to use.
fields.summary: Have the possibility to send slack notifications on certain events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you import data from Jira into a sheet with existing content, a warning will appear indicating that 'You are about to overwrite everything in columns A - <n>. Are you sure you want to continue?'. If you proceed, despite the column specification in the warning, all columns in the sheet are overwritten including ones outside the A - <n> column range.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new sheet
 # Enter text cell content in column 'L' or whatever the column immediately proceeding the imported issue data will be
# Import issues from Jira

h3. Expected Results
If the existing content is outside the bounds of the column range indicated in the warning, it will not be overwritten.

h3. Actual Results
All columns in the sheet are overwritten.

h3. Workaround
Once the initial import occurs, the button in the side bar will change to 'Refresh Issues'. Using this refresh does not overwrite content created outside the column range of the imported issue data the way the initial import does.
fields.summary: Importing Issues from Jira Replaces Existing Cell Content in All Columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to Scroll attachments inside the email viewer on Jira, when an email is sent to an issue with attachments using the Jira Cloud Outlook add-in.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email with the *Send to issue* function from the Jira Cloud add-in of Outlook that contains attachments
 # Open the email sent on the issue and try to view all attachments

h3. Expected Results
Availability to scroll the attachments inside the email viewer
h3. Actual Results
No scroll option to view all attachments
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to Scroll attachments inside the email viewer

fields.description:
I have began to rely on the slack integration for keeping up with the multiple projects I'm involved with, and I don't like that it adds a signature when I comment on something. Could we get a toggle for this? 

 

It looks like this issue was addressed in API-195, but only for Service Desk projects. I'm seeing the same behavior on my Next-gen project.
fields.summary: Allow toggle for "This comment was left via Slack." for all types of projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When configuring the connection between Jira Cloud and Slack, you can customise the configuration, including notifications that will be sent when matching certain criteria.

Currently, that's possible only at project level. That means you have to build the desired configuration for each desired project individually.

h3. Suggestion

In order to avoid a big amount of work, specially when you have a big number of projects, it would be nice to have the possibility of building a global configuration that would work for all projects.
fields.summary: Ability to build global configurations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the Jira Cloud for Sheets/Excel integration to export issues will show all the dates in UTC and not under the user profile timezone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the issue navigator and build a JQL;
# Export the issues using the Jira Cloud for Sheets/Excel integration;
# Check the date and time fields.

h3. Expected Results
The issues are exported using the user timezone.

h3. Actual Results
The issues are exported using UTC instead of their own timezones.

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
Export the issues using the [Jira export|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/exporting-issues-776636787.html] functionality

h4. Workaround 2
Import the issues by using the JQL method from the Excel's or Google Sheet side instead of opening the results from the Jira's issue search navigation view.
fields.summary: Exporting issues using the Google Sheets/Excel integration will show dates in UTC

fields.description:
When importing Jira issues into Sheets using the Jira Cloud for Google Sheets add-on, empty fields do not return true for the ISBLANK() function in Google.
This can be worked around by using the Len() function against the cell to check if the cell is 0 length, however, Google sheets is seeing the cells as being populated with something.

Adding the value of two cells populated in this way will return 0 or 0 plus any actual number added, so it seems that the value is a null and a zero at the same time.

I would like to suggest potentially formatting null values populated from Jira to blank cells if possible.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Google Sheets empty fields are not "ISBLANK()" compatible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Reacting with emoji to Slack notification does not update the product. According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html, reacting with certain emojis should trigger the like:
{quote}
Use reactions to take action in Confluence when the @confluence bot is invited to a channel:
Add 👍 to a notification or link preview for a page, post, or comment to like the item in Confluence
Add ⭐ to a notification or link preview for a page or post to add it to your saved for later
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect a Confluence page to a Slack channel and link your account
# Add a comment to the page
# Confirm that a Slack notification is triggered
# Add a thumbsup or star emoji as a reaction
# Reload the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
The comment is liked. In Slack side, the following message is shown.
{code}
I've liked that comment on :page_facing_up: <page name> for you in Confluence Cloud. To unlike it, just get rid of the :+1: reaction you added to the comment preview.
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The comment is not liked. In Slack side, no messages are shown. 

h3. Note
This is not happening in all instances. Upon support's testing, some instances did not have this bug reproduced.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Reacting with emoji to Slack notification does not update the product

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Integrate Slack with Confluence is awesome when we are sharing articles and information with our team.
When someone adds an inline comment in a page from a space that is integrated with a Slack channel, if we click over the *View in Confluence* option, it doesn't redirect us to the inline comment in fact, but to the page where it is.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have a [Confluence space integrated with Slack|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-slack-and-confluence-together/];
# On this space, highlight some text and insert an inline comment;
# Go to the Slack channel that is integrated and locate the notification of the inline comment;
# Click over the *View in Confluence* button.

h3. Expected Results
You are redirected to the page and then the inline comment modal is open for the respective comment.

h3. Actual Results
You are just redirected to the page in which the inline comment is.

*Notes*:

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slack notification for inline comments don't redirect to the inline comment
